title: PhD Studentship in Computational Materials Science
fundingDetails: Full tuition fees and stipend covered
topicBrief: We are seeking a highly motivated PhD student to work on machine learning approaches for materials discovery. The project will focus on developing novel neural network potentials for predicting material properties and accelerating computational screening of functional materials.
requirements: MSc or BSc (First Class) in Physics, Chemistry, Materials Science, or related field
Strong programming skills (Python, preferably with ML libraries)
Background in computational chemistry or materials science
Excellent written and oral communication skills
whatWeOffer: Full funding covering tuition fees and living expenses
Collaborative research environment with leading experts

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Defect Physics
topicBrief: We have an opening for a postdoctoral researcher to investigate defect physics in wide-bandgap semiconductors using first-principles calculations. The successful candidate will work on an EPSRC-funded project in collaboration with leading UK universities and industry partners.
requirements: PhD in Physics, Materials Science, Chemistry, or related field
Extensive experience with DFT calculations (VASP, Quantum ESPRESSO, or similar)
Track record of publications in peer-reviewed journals
Experience with defect calculations and hybrid functionals preferred
whatWeOffer: Opportunity to work on cutting-edge research projects

title: MSc Research Project Opportunities
topicBrief: We offer MSc project opportunities across various topics in computational materials science, including materials for energy applications, machine learning in materials discovery, and quantum simulations of novel materials.
requirements: Enrolled in an MSc program in Physics, Chemistry, Materials Science, or related field
Strong motivation and ability to work independently
whatWeOffer: Access to computational resources and software
Opportunity to contribute to ongoing research projects
Networking opportunities with researchers in the field
